Class ResourceLocation

java.lang.Object
team.logica_populi.dragonscore.base.ResourceLocation
public class ResourceLocation extends Object
A resource location represents a path in the format namespace:path. It provides an interface for working with both files and resources that can be specified using the resource location path system. A resource location will be turned into a path of the following form ./namespace/path.

  • Constructor Details

    • ResourceLocation

      public ResourceLocation(String namespace, String path)
      Create a Resource Location using a separate namespace and path. A resource location represents te path to a file or jar resource. It has many helper methods to read, write, and create.
      Parameters:
      namespace - The namespace for this resource location
      path - THe path for this resource location

    • ResourceLocation

      public ResourceLocation(String resourceLocation)
      Create a Resource Location using a string formatted as namespace:path.
      Parameters:
      resourceLocation - The formatted string

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • getAsFile

      public File getAsFile()
      Get this resource location as a path object.
      Returns:
      The path for this resource location.

    • tryGetResource

      public String tryGetResource()
      Tries to get the resource this resource location is pointing to. The search order will first search the current working directory (Allows for file overriding) then inside the jar resources.
      Returns:
      The resource contents as a string.

    • tryGetResource

      public String tryGetResource(String pathPrefix)
      Tries to get the resource this resource location is pointing to. The search order will first search the current working directory (Allows for file overriding) then inside the jar resources.
      Parameters:
      pathPrefix - A prefix to put after the namespace but before the path.
      Returns:
      The resource contents as a string

    • createIfNotExists

      public void createIfNotExists()
      Create the file for this resource location if it does not exist

    • write

      public void write(String data)
      Writes data to the file for this Resource Location. This will create the file if it does not exist.
      Parameters:
      data - The data to write

    • exists

      public boolean exists()
      Does this fle exist?
      Returns:
      true if the file for this resource location exists
